availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Emily Goodloe. Student in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Attorney in Boyle County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 375A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 611, p. .21 of 29 of microfilm (accessed via ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 936.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 167A, p. 41 of 47 of microfilm (accessed via ancestry.com)..
Find A Grave, "Maj William Goodloe (1837-1903)," Memorial #42541311, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42541311 (accessed September 11, 2020).
